channel.title: I'm Back
channel.description:
[Notice : This is going to be a lot of reading. ]
Hi guys, I have decided to come back to the Mopar forums, some of you might remember me as a person, and some of you might only recognize my username, all with a blur I guess. For the ones who don't know me, I will introduce myself.
I am Assassins Creed Fan ( Real name : Floris ) I am 17 years old, and have been on this forum for one year or so in 2009, maybe 2010, I can't quite remember. When I quitted the forums, it was because models didn't get my attention anymore.
For the ones who still remember me, I can tell you that this school year, I have began to take a Gamedesign class to become a Game Artist, I am still in my first weeks of school, and we can not use Metasequoia, we are using AutoDesk Maya , and I am not getting the heck of it to be completely honest with you guys, so if any of you are using Maya, I would like to ask you for tips, or tutorials that you think that might help me on my way to getting to learn the programme.
This week, we had to make a sketch of a Legoman character with no hands, although I have added some shoulders. I am posting this thread, to ask you guys what you guys think of my model, and to let you know that I will be posting on a regular base real soon.
Here is the model, I named my 'project' LegoBob, don't ask why, I just find it catchy.
[IMG]http://i51.tinypic.com/rmv3oj.png[/img]
Greetings, Assassins Creed Fan ( Floris )

item.title: I'm Back
item.dc:creator: @Vexx Vexx
item.description:
@Vexx wrote:

nice to see you again bro!

Read full topic

Welcome back by the way[/quote]Finally the 5 words that I wanted from you ! Thanks a lot man.

item.title: I'm Back
item.dc:creator: @Assassins_Creed_Fan Assassins Creed Fan
item.description:
@Assassins_Creed_Fan wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:17, topic:417657”]If your models weren’t getting attention why didn’t you go to mitb’s graphics board or join a real art forum?[/quote]You sir, need to read before you post, Models (to get deeper into it Overall Modelling) didn’t get MY attention anymore, not that my models didn’t get attention anymore, I just wasn’t into modelling anymore, but it things have changed.

Read full topic

item.title: I'm Back
item.dc:creator: @Assassins_Creed_Fan Assassins Creed Fan
item.description:
@Assassins_Creed_Fan wrote:

[quote=“The Wanderer, post:15, topic:417657”]Well, it can’t really be poly overkill since there is no polygonal limit. Since you are modeling this for show I would use excessive amounts of polygons to make it look realistic as possible. If you assignment has a polygon cap, then disregard that. Also, try making the guy more detailed by adding those holes into the legs:

Also, here is what I think you should shoot for as far as how many polys:
http://i355.photobucket.com/albums/r471/LINKXGL/final_lego_guy.png[/quote]Those are actually very nice reference pictures, thanks a lot !

Read full topic

item.title: I'm Back
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Well, it can’t really be poly overkill since there is no polygonal limit. Since you are modeling this for show I would use excessive amounts of polygons to make it look realistic as possible. If you assignment has a polygon cap, then disregard that. Also, try making the guy more detailed by adding those holes into the legs:

Also, here is what I think you should shoot for as far as how many polys:

Read full topic

item.title: I'm Back
item.dc:creator: @Assassins_Creed_Fan Assassins Creed Fan
item.description:
@Assassins_Creed_Fan wrote:

[quote=“badger41, post:13, topic:417657”]Yes you have been gone a long time… the reason escapes me now all i remember is you were mad about something

OT: The pieces of the lego person are definitely not proportioned correctly with each other, looks like he has really big hips (if thats possible for a lego person ;))

And like rip said, the shoulders are definitely not lego based :P[/quote]If you mean the cylinder’ish bulge at his pants, that aren’t his hips, those are the joined (I don’t know how to name them) things that seperate the legs from the body of the legoman so that you can move his feet.

Read full topic

item.title: I'm Back
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

Yes you have been gone a long time… the reason escapes me now all i remember is you were mad about something

OT: The pieces of the lego person are definitely not proportioned correctly with each other, looks like he has really big hips (if thats possible for a lego person ;))

And like rip said, the shoulders are definitely not lego based

Read full topic

item.title: I'm Back
item.dc:creator: @Assassins_Creed_Fan Assassins Creed Fan
item.description:
@Assassins_Creed_Fan wrote:

Thank you all for the comments, I know that the model itself is a poly overkill, but I don’t care at the moment, as far as I am still learning the programme, not to say that I am proud of the model, or that I am full of self-ego or something, don’t get me wrong.
Also a huge thanks on the tips, I am currently in a bus to school, and as soon as I am at school and have some time on my own (no not that kind of time you little kids :P) I will get busy with the model.

Read full topic

item.title: I'm Back
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

Never knew you but welcome back.

Read full topic

item.title: I'm Back
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Seems a tad fat. If I were you I would just export my files from Meta to a .obj format and load into Maya. I never joined in time to actually see your work, but I have heard a lot of things about you. My only suggestion to impress your teacher is to make loop cuts really close to the edges and then subdivide it. She/He would probably like that.

Read full topic

item.title: I'm Back
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

From what I can tell…

-Its triangulated already, and it apparently showed up in the rendering. It also appears as if the triangulation made each rectangle have 4 triangles inside of it. Not sure whats up with that, so meh.
-The cylinder(s) for the shoulders looks like its one whole cylinder with many segments. If it is, that is a HUGE waste of polygons.
-The same applies with the brim of the hat, although it isn’t as much as a waste. Still, make it look like a smoother transition. I understand it’s lego, but c’mon Just move it inwards a little bit so it is more flush.

And welcome back, ACF.

Read full topic

item.title: I'm Back
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

The shoulders are not lego :/.

But WB

Read full topic

item.title: I'm Back
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

You’re indeed back, even after almost killing your self you return.

Happy to see ya mate, as for the model it looks like you have more faces then needed o.o

P.S ready to get added to this thread : http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,476853.0.html

Read full topic

Holy shit. Welcome back.

item.title: I'm Back
item.dc:creator: @Assassins_Creed_Fan Assassins Creed Fan
item.description:
@Assassins_Creed_Fan wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:4, topic:417657”][quote author=Assassins Creed Fan link=topic=520210.msg3777564#msg3777564 date=1318201108]

Oh I remember you… welcome back!
[/quote] Thanks mate, but do you have some critisism on my model?

I’d like to see a wireframe before I do that.[/quote]I can tell you that the wireframe is frikking horrible, I am a total noob at Maya, and therefor I have just primitive modelled everything and moved the stuff together, no joining of polygons and faces, just moving the objects edges together.
/facepalm for myself.

Read full topic
